comments.body: This could be an alternative to adding saddle bags to horses and making it so 2 people can ride horses. It would also be useful for mob transportation
I can imagine this being altered to become plows for cows, making it so they can till dirt in a much larger area
Do all the stuff in your post but add ruby aurmor and ruby tools
MEGATRON2020 Rubies can't make armor and tools in real life I think but it is a cool concept you should make a feedback on that

Instead of adding a new ore for this (and we already have a red ore anyway: redstone), what if this functionality was added to diamonds instead? (Diamonds are used in laser tools as well.) Perhaps all the beacon-compatible minerals should have a unique effect when fed to a beacon.
My son's idea for rubies: Trade with blacksmith villagers to get uncraftable ruby armor (also rarely would spawn in chests).

I dont know why but I also feel like rubies would be a perfect new item for alchemy, like gold. Rubies could be crafted with apples and berries to make new ruby apples and ruby berries. These new ruby fruits could either been eaten to grant cool effects or be brewed to make brand new potions.

Perhaps wearing malachite armour could “soothe” some mobs, as it comes from the lush caves, a calm and beautiful biome, so if a neutral mob was angered by the player, after attacking the player wearing malachite armour, they would attack much weaker, and eventually forget why they were attacking you in the first place

I was going to suggest something similar. Copper ore should be a dark green or blue and green color resembling the actual copper ores because they’re beautiful. When mined, it should drop an ore block. If the ore block is smelted, it should yield copper. If taken to a crafting table, maybe four of them could be craftable into a decorative block of malachite with its distinctive light and dark green banding. The malachite block would be directional, so the sides would have wavy bands that line up, but the top would have more of a bubbly appearance, like an actual chunk of polished malachite. It would make sense for malachite to be craftable into green dye, too.

Alternatively, mining the ore block could drop up to 9 malachite fragments that can be smelted into copper nuggets or crafted into malachite blocks. Smelting the whole ore block (mined with silk touch) or a malachite block would give a copper ingot. The mechanic would be similar to how nether gold ore works but with an additional smelting stage to turn malachite pieces into nuggets.
@Evil Sharkey I wholly agree with you. These are my thoughts exactly. Please consider checking out my post on this topic called "Copper Ore Needs a Reskin". Thank you!

I sugest that Malachite found in a Biome called Crystal Caves. Beyond this ore being exclusive to this biome, it would have a higher chance to spawn Amethist Geodes and Lapis Lazuli, like gold in Mesa. The uses to Malachite would be mostly about enchanting and more magic in Minecraft. So, it could be used to alter the enchantment shown in the enchantment table,and when you alter it, consumes the Malachite shard, making a cool animation, like the totem of undying

Another use for it would be combining it with Lapis to make a crystal called  Magic Crystal, that can make a new set of magic armor and tools, that would give the same protection as iron, the durability of diamond armor and would be more suitable to enchantments, costing only 2 levels to enchant anything that previously costed 3 levels or more. It aslo could be repaired with Malachite and Lapis, it doesn´t need to be the formed crystal.One final use would be for a Magic Block, also made with Malachite and Lapis, that when put under an Enchanting table would reduce the amount of bookshelfs needed to get lvl 30 by a third.

I think it's a great idea! But I think that the only change to raw copper should be the texture and the name. I think that if you craft nine malachite you should be able to get a block of malachite, too.
Our ancestors didn't smelt raw copper, they smelted malachite; "raw copper" has a name. Minecraft should use it.

Did you know that malachite is green because it contains iron? Azurite is a blue copper ore that does not have iron.
I love this idea and fully support it! This would be awesome and makes perfect sense.
I had the same idea and think it would be awesome
Maybe like stronger bows or something.
Very interesting indeed...  Maybe these tablets could be used to craft special weapons!
Maybe the ability to upgrade to Netherite would need to be found by this method first
A "giant" sword, a battle axe, a sythe... New special weapons like the Trident!
also an ability to find eyes of ender and/or a map to the stronghold to make it possible for peaceful players to finish the game. Would be a great feature imo!

I agree with this concept. Unearthing and piecing-together strange skeletons would be quite rewarding! Imagine building a library with various displays...

Artifacts that can be displayed and shown-off in-general is a fine idea, because it provides a far greater variety to the rewards in generated structures. Strange skulls, old art-pieces, and crumbling idols for example. Trophies that remind you of an adventure, instead of just more resources for the heap.
And you can also brush soul soil for miniature Nether fossils.

This would be an interesting way to implement sharks & whales! (Hear me out, I'm not kidding) What if the sharks & whales are simply extinct, and all we have to remember them by is their bones... :(  (but never having sharks at all would be WAY more :(  ) Also, it would be a great way to raise awareness for animals not added to the game. (ie. sharks)
If you push 9 chicken nuggets together do you get a chicken? The answer is no this should not be reversible
Well well since when did Minecraft follow logic? If you put two iron ingots and a stick next to each other in real life you wouldn’t get a sword. Same goes for the chicken nuggets.

Maybe they could have special properties like increased durability or speed.

 

Also you should be able to craft stone tools with stone.

You can't craft a stone cutter without these so it has more of a use than the structural blocks. However I did up-vote it because I agree about the tool situation. Plus it would be nice to be able to spend diorite on a tool so I dont have to look at it.
It also makes sense because you can make stone tools with blackstone.

It kinda sounds like a feature that wont get used much, but it is a great way use up all of those nearly useless blocks in your inventory after a hard day of mining on your new minecraft world. Maybe they could have the same durability as stone, so you can save your stone for something else. Or possibly be better than stone in some way? It just makes sense so i'm voting.

Same now you can craft stone tools from Grimstone, so this idea makes even more sense.
Additionally, it should be possible to craft stone tools from ordinary stone.
Nice Idea love it <3

I feel like this could come along with a parity update to bedrock. How do we get splash potions? brewing. How do we get the milk in bottles? A Cauldron! Bedrock edition already has lava + dyed water in cauldrons, (and you can make maps from just paper), and potions in cauldrons, so why not add milk in cauldrons! then you could make a milk bottle (disable drinking from a bucket of course, you can drink a water bucket can you?) and brew a potion of milk. 

I wonder what would happen if you added other ingredients to the milk? maybe a splash that clears their effects + hits them with an effect of your own?

I would like to see the throwable milk also removing the poison effects caused by potions, Witches, or the Wither.

Brewing = you fill a Glass Bottle with milk directly from a cow, then place it in a Brewing Stand and add Gunpowder to make it throwable.

I would not change the mechanics of the golden apple for the zombie villager.

Yes please! That's a good idea but i think it would be better if they added wither skeleton horses!

For example in the soul soil and the blue fire biome (can't remmember the name) could spawn wither skeletons riding wither skeleton horses!
You watch SystemZee?
I think this would make perfect sense and I'd love another type of craftable food.
Chicken Broth?

Maybe go a little simpler with the recipe.
Chicken + Potato + Carrot + Bowl = Stew.
My favorite meal.
That would be OP, What would stop if you from having an inventory full of them?
no. the point is to hold it.
No no no. Shield + totem = every sigle pvp battle lasts for like 10h.
I think the point is to keep the player from using shields, so you instead have a way to literally cheat death at the cost of defensive ability.
If you have a stockpile of totems, you would become god. Especially on a SMP (Survival Multiplayer) server. Imagine the already overpowered Raid farms.
This seems a little too OP...
That would be over powered, After getting fortune III you have unlimited diamonds

The use of the smithing table turned out to be very disappointing, I think this is a very good idea to give it value, in addition to the fact that these attributes would only be used in the early game, because more advanced in the game you already have all your tools completely enchanted .

Well it wouldn't effect how many of the ore dropped but things like speed or durability and I will admit that my idea for the pickaxes upgrade was a half effort kinda thing, because it snot easy to create a good boost to it that players will be dying to have. That being said if that was still  thing maybe a stone pick could mine redstone but not diamond and iron could mine debris. The stone pickaxe wouldn't be used that much anyways and debris needs diamond anyways to be of any use. Obviously the idea needs some refinement, but I would encourage you to refine *your* comment and say exactly what you mean so that I can better form ideas for tempering. Ive also thought that with the introduction of netherite diamonds may lose some of their value so having unlimited diamonds, which many people already have if they play singleplayer, a server whose currency is seperate from diamonds or a server like sci-craft, wont be that impressive and it will be all about the netherite thus balancing tempering to the degree you have cited.

I totally agree about the smithing table. When the dev's said that they were going to find a better use, rather than make diamond up gradable to netherite, and people said we like the netherite thing really disappointed me. Mainly because that is it's only use. Plus for such a cheap block. I mean, you could have this block before you have a iron pickaxe. I also like this concept. The only things I don't like is the examples you gave. I get the gold on tools and the iron idea is ok, but all the others are too overpowered. Like the gold on armor for example. The whole purpose of the piglin feature is to give gold a purpose. Other than that it is pointless. Good concept, but we could find better uses for each mineral.
I have no idea what he just said

He basically said that the idea I made was good but some aspects of it need changing. I agree and this idea was more for inspiration for a core feature. I’m not sure how they could take it or where but I wanted to get the general idea and name, as pretty proud of that, out there. I also hope to show commitment to this idea by coming back to it over and over. Unfortunately my idea for the UI may have not made it through because I attached a photo to it which may‘ve invalidated it. Oh well. But to the previous person I agree that it needs fixing and modifying a bit but that’s why it takes consideration.

I was just about to suggest tempering for netherite by using a lava bucket on it in the blast furnace, Love your idea though, Your idea has a better place in the overall game ballance, this would especially come in handy in early game hardcore.
I think having a sky block would be cool
Amazing
Makes sense considering we are getting a cave update. This would probably have to be a creative or command only block like the end gateway.
∞ build options

I think it would make the iconic cobweb lava trap harder to make, but I agree anyway. Mineshafts are the most annoying part of the game as cave spiders have higher reach than ravagers! The only way to deal with cave spiders is lava, so I wouldn't mind watching their home burn down as well.
You could lay down a path of string as a fuse for tnt!

I think that burning string would not trigger a tripwire hook, considering that no force is being applied to the string. Flaming cobwebs and string should also be able to set you on fire if it is on fire, like any other burning object. Maybe you could put string and blaze powder together in a crafting table to get string that isn’t flammable, and retains any burning property forever.

Burning cobweb is fine I guess, but string is incredibly useful as a fire proofing material, as it is almost invisible. Aside of that, I hate the look of a non full block burning, as it just leaves the fire floating in the air

I think an item like it could be good, but I think maybe another mob would be better. Even though the silverfish is technically renewable it could be very hard to farm because of the portal in the way.

Well then, a new source of Silverfish other than the spawner in Strongholds and the random infested stone blocks in mountain biomes could be added.

I've seen some suggestions about a Silverfish Nest, that would be a good idea for a dungeon/structure.

It could either have Silverfish spawners or have them spawn naturally, like the Ocean Monuments and Pillager Outposts do with Guardians and Pillagers.
I will say I like this idea but some mobs already aim pretty poorly like skeletons sometimes.

Maybe warped nether wart could be used to get negative effects such as the already existing poison, slowness, and harming, as well as things that dont have potions (blindness, wither, nausea, hunger) and new potions that arent currently in-game, such as paralysis/freezing, or a potion similar to Skyrim's "frenzy" (mob attacks any other mob for X amount of time), while the regular nether wart would be used for positive effects?
Updated title to better reflect contents.
I agree, but I would name it warped nether wart. It's more consistent.
Or maybe you could use drops from that animal to craft it?
It could also be a netherite shulker box, but the barrel is better.
Chests already don’t burn in lava
Or maybe the “Netherite container”. It can contain your stuff and doesn’t burn in lava, just like your idea, but it doesn’t have to be a barrel or a shulker box, but something new.
With the amount of gold you can get from pigman farms and mining in mesas, along with the planned addition of gold ore to the nether, I don't think this would be used all too often.

This would be fun, but the Alchemy Table is too easy to make. Even though there is a chance you won't get any gold, the Alchemy Table is too easily obtained for an item that would basically give you infinite gold (Coal is very easy to find, of course). And gold doesn't have too many good uses (Except for powered rails), so this wouldn't be a very interesting feature unless gold had an important use.

@DismalCap568303, gold has plenty of uses, the most common being golden carrots. But gold is also going to be used for trading with piglins in the coming update, so I feel that this would be perfect. Also, it isn't too op because you still need to mine the coal, get the water, and you still only have a 60% chance to get anything even using 10 coal. Mojang could also just increase that amount if they found it too op, but I doubt they will. Also,  this would be difficult to farm since the only way to get auto coal is by using a wither skeleton farm (which, needless to say, is extremely endgame) and the gold output would barely be worth it with pigman farms in the game right now, especially considering the exp factor from the pigman farm. This would be a very nice midgame block to use in conjunction with a carrot farm to produce sufficient food, since by midgame you should have lots of coal and better ways to smelt and light up without it.

Also not to forget wither skeleton farms

but aside from that I think an alchemy table has potential, maybe change the design of the table change the format for the grid and give it a challenging quest to stop farming how about adding an insanely OP boss almost of that of the wither and give it a special drop using it's drop you can convert coal into gold or maybe with a certain amount of this new drop you can make new items possibly one that could convert your exp into an exp bottle so it can allow you to store exp after you die, to stop it from getting to OP maybe making it as example- if you have five levels convert in a bottle then if you splash it it will only produce four levels, this would be good if you want to give your friend some exp or you want to keep it stored in case you die. But the alchemy table has so much potential even to the point were you can make previous uncraftable items like the totem of undying for example if you wanted to craft it you would need some gold, emerald, 100 levels of exp and that special drop from that OP boss. I don't really know, I would like to keep the boss and its drop unnamed because maybe you can make an idea from that.
and also iron ingot in lapis lazuli or lapis lazuli in iron ingot
This is one of the most brilliant Nether update suggestions I have seen yet! It goes so perfect with Minecraft and its alchemy aspects.
I think fall damage on the leaves must be decreased as well.

I see a lot of uses for this, however don't like the idea of leaves needing protection if I'm decorating with them. An alternative may be to have the player pass through the leaves without destroying the leaves. One other addition to the idea could be for leaves to reduce fall speed slightly, so thicker groups of leaves take more speed to pass through.
are there porkchop sandwiches in your idea because porkchop is pork steak
LIVE THE POTATOES AND THE FRENCH FRIES !!!
It's not a bad idea, you could make it so if you eat it the Piglin beast won't attack you because you smell like it (because "bloat makes me think of pigs"

There is the potential to be able to plant regular crops in the nether but have them grow into mutated crops that the player can eat. Ex. Potatoes turning into Warped Potatoes. 

Perhaps we could have some sort of vine crop in the nether. Ex. take the weeping vines and have them produce some sort of fruit when they reach certain stages of growth. 

These could then be food items that could be used to interact with Hoglins and maybe even provide the player with some positive effect when eaten such as fire resistance.

I love this idea and it would be cool to find a new kind of melon or something in the nether to harvest. A new kind of jack'o'lantern would be cool too, maybe it could have soul fire instead or something.
I agree but the ice should be cut with the stone cuter also they should add an ice pick
Packed and blue ice stairs should allow you to slide down them smoothly and that could help with building something like a waterslide
